messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Scavenger hunt
messages.msgSnippet: ROTF.  Well... you do have a point.   But this list and the newsletter list don t overlap overly much.  How s that for a defense? Lisa ... From:
messages.messageBody:
ROTF. Well... you do have a point. <G> But this list and the newsletter
list don't overlap overly much. How's that for a defense?

Lisa

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Scavenger hunt
messages.msgSnippet: A FAILURE??????? That is something you are NOT! Sorry, I m too much of a fan to let you get away with that! ... Ann
messages.messageBody:
A FAILURE???????
That is something you are NOT!
Sorry, I'm too much of a fan to let you get away with that!
:)
Ann

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Scavenger hunt
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 3/29/01 9:04:55 PM, hooperck@alltel.net writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 3/29/01 9:04:55 PM, hooperck@... writes:

<< But I did just that!!! and....AHEM, there was no folder ;)
Just giving you a hard time Sandra. Ha, ha!! >>

[Trying to turn this to something better than it is....]

Sometimes when you're looking for something you have to ASK someone!

Sometimes a book isn't on the shelf where it's supposed to be, or a weblink
isn't working, or a folder isn't up yet.

(no, too lame---I was a failure...)

Sandra Dodd
______________________________
http://expage.com/RadicalUnschooling
______________________________
______________________________

messages.subject: Scavenger hunt
messages.msgSnippet: Dear Sandra, The Scavenger Hunt post sounds very interesting but when I went to the message boards at unschooling.com I was overwhelmed.  Can you help point me
messages.messageBody:
Dear Sandra,
The Scavenger Hunt post sounds very interesting but when I went to
the message boards at unschooling.com I was overwhelmed. Can you help
point me in the right direction? Under which subject may I find the
Hunt?
Thanks,
Caroline in LA
